short_summary: Request for Tender for Audio-Visual Production Services
full_summary:
**Letter of Interest: Audio-Visual Production Services**
=====================================

**Solicitation Information**

* **Solicitation Reference Number:** WS4328480094
* **Solicitation Title:** Audio-Visual Production Services
* **Publication Date:** December 1, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 31, 2023

**Contract Information**

* **Expected Contract Start Date:** September 30, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date:** Not Specified

**Notice Information**

* **Notice Type:** Request for Information
* **Notice Status:** Expiré (Expired)
* **Notice URL:** [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18165794?extsite=MTgxNjU3OTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18165794?extsite=MTgxNjU3OTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

**Description of Work**

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking industry input and feedback for the upcoming Renewal of Audio-Visual Production Supply Arrangement (EN578-220462). This supply arrangement is set to expire on October 31, 2024.

Industry stakeholders are invited to provide information and insights through a Request for Information (RFI) process. The RFI will be hosted on the Government of Canada's procurement portal, [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca). This opportunity is aimed at gathering industry knowledge and identifying potential requirements for the new supply arrangement.

The Supply Arrangement renewal will focus on providing high-quality audio-visual production services to support the government's communications and program delivery activities. The resultant supply arrangement is expected to be awarded through a competitive process.

Feel free to communicate with the Contracting Authority, mark.roussel@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca, for any information or clarification regarding this notice. The Government of Canada thanks industry for its participation in this important initiative.

Remember to format your output in a nice markdown format

Also try to reduce the content to a 400 words document at most. eliminate any unnecessary information that is not contributing to the actual message. 

In your output I would expect to see a great and solid English usage and letter writing etiquette. Good luck with your rewrite!

Solution
